Name: Cameron Hayes
College Background: Cameron Hayes, born on July 15, 2004, in Phoenix, Arizona, is an American basketball player. He attended Arizona State University, where he made a strong impression during his freshman season. Hayes averaged 14.8 points, 3.9 rebounds, and 3.2 assists per game while leading the Sun Devils in three-point shooting. Despite his natural talent, his lack of consistent effort in practice was a point of concern for coaches. Nevertheless, his performance earned him Pac-12 Freshman of the Year honors.
High school Background: Rated as high as No. 18 overall by 247Sports … McDonald’s All-American … Arizona Gatorade Player of the Year in 2023 … Helped his high school, Desert Valley Academy, secure two state championships, averaging 28.3 points and 6.1 rebounds in his senior year … Known for his sharpshooting ability, hitting 48% of his three-point attempts throughout his high school career … Averaged 26.7 points, 4.2 assists, and 4.8 rebounds per game as a junior, with several 40+ point games.
Work ethic: While undeniably talented, Cameron Hayes' work ethic has been a recurring question mark. Coaches and scouts have often noted his inconsistent dedication to practice and improvement. Arizona State head coach Bobby Hurley remarked, 'Cameron has a gift for scoring, especially from deep, but we need him to bring the same intensity to the gym every day. His potential is limitless if he commits to putting in the work.'
